Generally, Heritrix is not yet well-sutted for incremental
or continuous crawling, which would most benefit from
modification-date, etag, or content-change analysis.

Kris Sigurï¿½sson's work, the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier (included
in the standard Heritrix distribution), could be of interest
here. It revisits sites according to a schedule, and adjusts
the revisit intervals based on observed change rates of
resources.

It doesn't use HEAD or if-modified-since requests, but I
believe the associated HTTPMidFetchUnchangedFilter will
consult modification times and etags, when present, to
make a quick determination that a resource is unchanged.
If so, the GET will be aborted early (and the scheduling
adjusted as necessary).

It's only been designed for, and used for, a small number
of media sites (like daily newspapers), but will be a basis
for future general Heritrix improvements in these areas.

- Gordon @ IA
